title: Elevate permissions for two specific users to administrator role

requirements.text: In the backend, add initialization logic (or upgrade hook) that ensures users with the email identifiers 'daniel@periniprojetos.com.br' and 'danielperini.mc@viadutodasartes.org.br' are assigned the administrator role (e.g., 'coordenador_geral' or the highest-privilege role available in the system). This should run on canister upgrade so that their roles are updated even if they already exist in the userProfiles stable state.

quotes: faz o login mas seguem como coordenador e precisam de autorizacoes como por exemplo exlcuir usuario. apenas as autorizacoes sao necessarias

acceptanceCriteria: After canister upgrade, the user profile for 'daniel@periniprojetos.com.br' has the administrator/coordenador_geral role.
After canister upgrade, the user profile for 'danielperini.mc@viadutodasartes.org.br' has the administrator/coordenador_geral role.
Both users can perform privileged actions such as deleting other users without receiving authorization errors.
Other existing users retain their original roles unchanged.

requirements.text: Generate a migration.mo that upgrades existing userProfiles stable state, applying the administrator role to the two specified users ('daniel@periniprojetos.com.br' and 'danielperini.mc@viadutodasartes.org.br') while preserving all other user profile data unchanged.

quotes: faz o login mas seguem como coordenador e precisam de autorizacoes como por exemplo exlcuir usuario. apenas as autorizacoes sao necessarias

acceptanceCriteria: migration.mo correctly maps the two target users to the administrator role.
All other user profiles remain identical after migration.
No data loss occurs for any user profile during migration.

constraints: Only the roles of 'daniel@periniprojetos.com.br' and 'danielperini.mc@viadutodasartes.org.br' should be changed â€” no other user data should be modified.
Do not alter any frontend files.
nonGoals: Adding new UI for role management.
Changing the permission model or role hierarchy.
Modifying any other user's role or profile data.
